channel.title: CyberNetSec - Ransomware
channel.description: Latest ransomware threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Ransomware Attacks on Critical Industries Skyrocket by 34%, KELA Reports
item.description:
A new report from cyber intelligence firm KELA reveals a staggering 34% year-over-year increase in ransomware attacks targeting critical industries between January and September 2025. These vital sectors, including manufacturing, healthcare, and energy, accounted for half of all 4,701 recorded globa...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Anubis Ransomware Hits Australian Engineering Firm Aussie Fluid Power
item.description:
The Australian industrial engineering company, Aussie Fluid Power, has confirmed it was hit by a ransomware attack claimed by the emerging 'Anubis' ransomware group. The incident, which has impacted company operations and stakeholder data, aligns with warnings from the Australian Cyber Security Cent...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

item.title: Clop Ransomware Claims Harvard University Breach, Threatens Data Leak
item.description:
The prolific Russian-speaking ransomware group Clop has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Harvard University, adding the prestigious institution to its data leak site on October 12, 2025. The group, known for its 'big-game hunting' and exploitation of zero-day vulnerabilities, threate...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Volkswagen Probes 8Base Ransomware Attack Claim
item.description:
The Volkswagen Group is investigating a claim from the 8Base ransomware group that it has breached the automotive giant and stolen sensitive data. 8Base, a data extortion group linked to Phobos ransomware, posted a trove of allegedly stolen files on its dark web site, including accounting documents ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Claims Collins Aerospace Hack; Leak Site Mysteriously Goes Offline
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed responsibility for the September 2025 cyberattack on Collins Aerospace, a major aviation and defense contractor. The attack caused widespread disruption, affecting check-in and boarding systems at major European airports like Heathrow and Brussels. Shortly af...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Ransomware Attacks Surge by 46% as Threat Actors Target Construction and Manufacturing
item.description:
Despite a slight decrease in overall weekly cyber attacks, ransomware activity has surged by 46%, according to a new report from Check Point Research. This indicates a strategic shift by threat actors towards more focused and impactful ransomware campaigns. The construction, business services, and i...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Akira Ransomware Gang Actively Exploiting SonicWall VPNs for Network Breaches
item.description:
The Akira ransomware group is actively exploiting vulnerabilities in SonicWall SSL VPN devices to gain initial access to corporate networks. By targeting these widely used, internet-facing appliances, the threat actors can establish a foothold, move laterally, exfiltrate sensitive data, and ultimate...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft Thwarts Ransomware Campaign by Revoking 200+ Malicious Code-Signing Certificates
item.description:
Microsoft has taken decisive action to disrupt a ransomware campaign by the threat group Vanilla Tempest (also known as Vice Society), which has been targeting education and healthcare. The group was using over 200 fraudulently obtained code-signing certificates to sign counterfeit Microsoft Teams i...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

item.title: LockBit Ransomware Returns from Hiatus with Upgraded 'Version 5.0'
item.description:
After a two-month hiatus following law enforcement disruption, the prolific LockBit ransomware group has returned, announcing the release of LockBit 5.0. This new version of the ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) malware incorporates significant technical upgrades designed to evade detection and analysi...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Living Off the Land: Hackers Abuse Velociraptor DFIR Tool to Deploy Ransomware
item.description:
A suspected China-based threat group, Storm-2603, is weaponizing the legitimate open-source digital forensics and incident response (DFIR) tool, Velociraptor. According to Cisco Talos, the attackers are using an outdated and vulnerable version of the tool (exploiting CVE-2025-6264) to gain persisten...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Ransomware, Malware
